Karen LEE Southgate
TUSCOLA COUNTY DHHS
1365 CLEAVER RD,
CARO, MI, 48723-9135
Re: License #: CP790201478
Dear Karen LEE Southgate:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
1/9/2024. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• Additional direction regarding discharge documentation and Medical
Passport maintenance was discussed/provided.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• None
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was a review of program challenges, agency
status regarding compliance maintenance, and a review of key performance
indicators.
2

Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. No concerns
were identified.
The analyst interviews with youth were positive and indicated appropriate
support/services are being provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is well maintained, and the storage of records is consistent with
licensing rule compliance.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
No safety concerns were identified during the analyst visit. Comments from
caregivers and youth indicated appropriate support/services are being provided.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
01/10/2024
